Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2009 07:59PM mb67 wrote: cancer not coming back in a radiation breast in (8 months)?  Is that what your doctor said?  I had lumpectomy, chemo, and rads..and 10 months later in same breast it came back..the radiologist told me to just wait and see, but I am not  a wait and see kind of girl...He actually said..."your new normal is abnormal, when reading a mammo"  WHATEVER!!  ohh and get this he said "it kinda looks like a crab" (my mamo) what the heck does that mean!!   I would go and get a 2nd opinion. I took my films went to Dana Farber and they told me it had come back...Scheduled a mast. for the next month and here we are....healed and relieved! Good luck!

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2008 08:44PM mb67 wrote: Hi My two boys are five and seven. But I can tell you after my mastectomy with tram flap recon. I could not lift anything, not a gallon of milk until 5-6 weeks post op. You won't feel comfortable lifting anything. Of course this depends on what kind of recon. if any you are having. I am now eight weeks post op and finally feeling like my old self, but it was a HUGE surgery, a LONG recovery and I am still not completly healed, I am having problems with a slow healing wound. but that is for another board. Good luck and get as much help as you can, Show her before hand how to climb into her car seat make a game out of it. You probably won't be able to drive for a few weeks anyway. MB
